text: "Qolobaa Calankeed" (; ; "Every nation has its own flag") is the national anthem of Somalia. ==Lyrics== Somali original (Somali Latin alphabet) Somali original (Osmanya script) Somali original (Wadaad writing) IPA transcription Official English translation Poetic English translation (ğ„†) Any nation's flag, bears its own color (ğ„‡) The sky (above us), does ours look like Defects it has none; love it with candor I (ğ„†) Oh you White Star, at your service we are (ğ„‡) Superior you are, in any part of our land Be famous oh Star, like the sun (of the far) II (ğ„†) On the day you arose, our hearts you have (ğ„‡) Purified with pureness, (Oh you our flag) Lord may not dim you, pray we in this night III (ğ„†) The detached part of, our forces of five (ğ„‡) I beseech from God, their return you cause This fate that wrote, for us to meet now (ğ„†) The flag of any nation beareth its color, (ğ„‡) but the sky, doth our flag resemble, and without defects; love it with candour! I (ğ„†) Oh thou White Star, at thy service we are (ğ„‡) Thou art superior, in any part of our land, be famous oh Star! like the sun of the far. II (ğ„†) On the day thou arosest, our hearts thou hast (ğ„‡) with pureness purified! oh thou banner, Lord shan't thee dim, in this night we pray. III (ğ„†) The detached part of, our forces of five. (ğ„‡) From Lord I beseech, their return thou causest this fate that wrote, for us now to meet. ==References== Category:African anthems Category:National symbols of Somalia
title: Qolobaa Calankeed
